comments: All and all shes a nice lady but does not know how to be reasonable or a good teacher. Shes an YA book writer that loves history but when talking about it in class I rather be water boarded. She hate confrontation and no grades are up for discussion even if you think she\'s made a mistake. This is completely unfair to the students.

comments: She is very passionate a fun to have as a teacher. In my class there was about 70 pages of reading assigned each week, as well as writing assignments. It was a lot of work but she is a very kind, caring knowledgable teacher.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  SO MANY PAPERS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: A really awesome lady who is so passionate about what she does! She teaches at UWB so she is a tougher grader and has higher expectations than most teachers I have had. She is kind and very tough at the same time. In her class be sure to follow all guidelines as well as do ALL of the readings and take good notes! Tests are rather difficult!

stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Tough class. I was stressed out towards the end of the quarter to get my grade where I wanted it and didn\'t quite get it there. I learned a lot. I really enjoyed being in her class and getting to know her (she has a lot of stories if you ask her to share).

stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  AMAZING LECTURES  GROUP PROJECTS
comments: If you put in the work, the grades will show with her. Started off with a very low grade and finished with a solid B, all because she saw how much effort I put in. I hate history and her lectures were never anything but fun! Sadly, the reading is dull, but her skills as a professor make up for that.

comments: Lousie not only loves history, she loves to teach history. She is a joy to take a class from.

stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  GROUP PROJECTS  EXTRA CREDIT
comments: She was a really great teacher in my opinion, if you ask her for help she is willing to sit down with you, and talk about what you are struggling with. In this class we had 7 quizzes, all multiple choice, near the end of the quarter you have to preform a 25minute skit. I reccommend her, but make sure all assignments are turned in on time.

comments: She\'s a good professor who is very passionate about what she is lecturing about which makes it more interesting as a student. However, there is quite a bit of reading that are very dry and boring to read.

stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Her lectures won\'t actually bore you to death like most teachers but she\'s not that good at teaching for a good grade. She goes way off topic and I love her enthusiasm on the subjects but it really doesn\'t help when you\'re studying for a quiz (theres one every week) and you have no idea whats on it. Good as a person, not that good of a teacher.

comments: The professor assigns a BOAT LOAD of readings that it becomes unbearable. She also will lecture the full 2 hours and even go over class time (She diverges A LOT and you don\'t know what she\'s going to put on the quizzes). On the bright side there isn\'t a final, only short quizzes every week with extra credit.

comments: Lots of readings, Weekly Quizzes on multiple chapters, Few assignments, Tough Grader. You either do really good or really bad in her class. No tests, one big group project and one final quiz.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  GET READY TO READ
comments: I have never found history so interesting before I took her class. When I took her class, she didn\'t have midterms or finals; instead we had 5 tests spaced throughout the quarter. These tests weren\'t super hard, but they were long and often had trick answers. Make sure that you\'re well studied! She also firmly believed in group work!

stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  GET READY TO READ  LECTURE HEAVY
comments: Very passionate about history. Gets off topic often. Long and sometimes dull lectures. Overall pretty chill teacher, just make sure you do the work. Also class is very textbook-based. If you don\'t read the textbook you will not do well in the class. Be prepared to be doing A LOT of reading including primary sources (old english language)

comments: I loved her! High recommended

tag_professor: Tough Grader (8)  Get ready to read (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Amazing lectures (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: No tests. No finals. Only short and fairly easy quizzes based on the information taught in class. Spiegler\'s goal was definitely to teach students information, not to stress them out or over work them. Readings are assigned but are rarely mandatory. There is a large group project, but it\'s easy enough to pull through. Very interesting class.

comments: I don\'t know what kind of experience everyone else had but she is a great teacher and approaches history with great enthusiasm.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (8)  Get ready to read (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Amazing lectures (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: She is amazing! She is very passionate about the subject matter and an all around great teacher!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (8)  Get ready to read (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Amazing lectures (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Louise is a super nice teacher! She is obviously very interested in history, and she was very knowledgeable! If you do the work along the guidelines you\'ll do well. My only complaints is that she did side-track a lot, and we barely used the textbooks. Quizzes were easy, no tests or midterms!! Loved her :)

tag_professor: Tough Grader (8)  Get ready to read (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Amazing lectures (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Spiegler goes over most concepts from required readings. She gave us timelines to understand better which helps a lot. Everything she discusses is very clear and she will always stop to review something more in-depth. Also, she is easy to reason with if a problem comes up and you can\'t turn something in on time.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (8)  Get ready to read (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Amazing lectures (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Hilarious (2)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Louise was an awesome professor. If you read everything that is assigned and absorb the material, you will ace all of the quizzes. The lowest ones are even dropped! If you know how to write, you will ace the essays. Overall, she was a wonderful history professor and I hope to take another one of her classes. History has never interested me before!
